column4: Does anyone know of a good VPN solution? I want to access my 192.168.5.0/24 subnet at home from outside. What is the best solution?
are you running linux at home?
open one port on the linux box...a weird one like 54987
then run sshd off that port.
you can ssh -x to that port...that puts you in the linux box
I have plenty of services running on my Ubuntu boxes here. .. I can' keep opening ports on my router .. well, I could but that kind of defeats the purpose
those Yes, I am familiar with what you are seeing and that is the short term solution I am adopting now.
harisund:no no....your router only has one open port.....to one box
Yes, I understand what you are saying. What I am saying is that my equirements are more than just the SSH port.
rag what do you mean where is kernel?
rag what do you want to do?
you can open more than one port...but every port you open increases the security risk
which is precisely why I want a VPN solution
rag yes, UBuntu doesn't ship with the kernel sources by default
rag you will have to download it .. I believe the sources are called linux-source-$(uname -r) or something like that.
right...the way I set my home network up I had total access to all my linux and windows boxes, via 'ssh -x'
